Selected Answer: A
Closest answer I could get as the question wording isn't great
vManage attributes include 
 • VM with a single pane of glass 
 • Multitenant with web scale 
 • Centralized provisioning, troubleshooting, and monitoring 
 • Deployed policies and templates 
 • Software upgrades 
 • GUI with role-based access control (RBAC) and per VPN visibility 
 • Programmatic interfaces (REST, NETCONF) 
Highly resilient

Selected Answer: D
D. vSmart supposed to be. the controller responsible for provisioning and configuration is the Cisco Catalyst SD-WAN Controller. This controller, formerly known as Cisco vSmart, plays a crucial role in managing and orchestrating the SD-WAN fabric. It ensures efficient communication between WAN edge routers, monitors network health, and facilitates policy enforcement across the network.

questions.question_text: Which controller is used for provisioning and configuration in a Cisco SD-WAN solution?
What is the result during a WAN Edge software upgrade process if the version of the WAN Edge software is higher than the one running on a controller device?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
If you upgrade the Cisco vEdge device software to a version higher than that running on a controller device, a warning message is displayed that software incompatibilities might occur. It is recommended that you upgrade the controller software first before upgrading the Cisco vEdge device software.

choices.D: The upgrade proceeds with no warning message.
choices.A: The upgrade button is greyed out.
choices.B: The upgrade fails with a warning message.
choices.C: The upgrade proceeds with a warning message.

choices.A: It faces interface buffer overflow problems.

questions.question_text: What problem happens on a device with two serial numbers, a unique device identifier (UDI), and a secure unique device identifier (SUDI) when an engineer provisions ISR 4000 by PnP using only a UDI?

choices.C: from TLOCs connected to the WAN transports

questions.question_text: What is one way an SD-WAN Edge router originates a vRoute?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
OMP Route Advertisements
On Cisco vSmart Controllers and Cisco vEdge devices, OMP advertises to its peers the routes and services that it has learned from its local site, along with their corresponding transport location mappings, which are called TLOCs. These routes are called OMP routes or vRoutes to distinguish them from standard IP routes. The routes advertised are actually a tuple consisting of the route and the TLOC associated with that route. It is through OMP routes that the Cisco vSmart Controllers learn the topology of the overlay network and the services available in the network.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/config-groups/configuration-group-guide/introduction.html
